pr_title: SAMZA-2431: Fix the checkpoint and changelog topic auto-creation.

timeline.author: prateekm

replies.bodyText:
Here's how this is done in KafkaCheckpointManager:
    val checkpointSpec = KafkaStreamSpec.fromSpec(StreamSpec.createCheckpointStreamSpec(checkpointTopic, checkpointSystemName))
        .copyWithReplicationFactor(kafkaConfig.getCheckpointReplicationFactor.get.toInt)
        .copyWithProperties(kafkaConfig.getCheckpointTopicProperties)

Can we do that here for consistency?
replies.author: prateekm

replies.bodyText:
Fixed the indentation.
Updated the checkpoint spec building to be consistent with KafkaCheckpointManager.
replies.author: shanthoosh

timeline.author: prateekm

replies.bodyText:
The control flow to create the checkpoint stream is the following:

Build the checkpoint spec in KafkaCheckpointManagerFactory, which uses kafkaConfig.getCheckpointProperties to populate the config in CheckpointSpec.
KafkaCheckpointManager.createStream uses the checkpoint spec that was built from 1 and KafkaSystemAdmin.createStream in-turn invokes KafkaSystemAdmin.toKafkaSpec.
KafkaSystemAdmin.toKafkaSpec(CheckpointSpec) above is used to convert the incoming spec of type StreamSpec to KafkaStreamSpec .

The config in incoming checkpoint StreamSpec is already built using   kafkaConfig.getCheckpointTopicProperties in KafkaCheckpointManagerFactory. So using kafkaConfig.getCheckpointProperties here again would be redundant, unnecessary and might return incorrect config-bag.
What do you think?
replies.author: shanthoosh

replies.bodyText: Got it, so the spec.getConfig here is already the checkpoint topic related subset. In that case, LGTM.
replies.author: prateekm

timeline.bodyText:
We can do it separately, can we add .copyWithConfig or .copyWithMap which takes Config or Map<String, String> ?
copyWithProperties is not user friendly, as we are converting a Map/Config to a properties, and this method basically convert it back.
timeline.author: kw2542

replies.bodyText: Yes, adding the copyWithConfig to KafkaStreamSpec might be good convenience API. We've additional cleanup planned with this control-flow in the near-future. If acceptable, then I can couple this change with that. Since it's a critical bug-fix, I would prefer to keep the change minimal by containing it to the fix alone and do the clean-up later.
replies.author: shanthoosh
